slim.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: someone who is slim is attractively thin
slim.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: very small in amount or number
slim.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Thereâ€™s only a slim chance that anyone survived the crash.
The Republicans held a slim majority in the Senate.
slim.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to make yourself thinner by eating less, taking a lot of exercise etc
slim.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: to reduce the size or number of something, or to become smaller in size or number
slim.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The multinational corporation slimmed its total assets by 3.2%.
Many large insurers are slimming down  (=employing fewer people).
slim.translation[3].definitions[0].defin: very small in size or amount
slim.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: The slim increase in revenues reflected the slowing economy.
Will the Democrats hold on to their slim majority?
slim.translation[3].definitions[1].defin: very little chance of something happening
slim.translation[3].definitions[1].examp: Chances are slim that such bosses will make as much money as they once earned.
There are slim hopes of a compromise.
